properties.name: The Statue of Liberty
properties.description: Posted by ZookeeperEllis Island The Statue of Liberty is located on Ellis Island. She stands for freedom and was given to the United States by France in 1886. She was sculpted by Frederic Bartholdi. From head to foot she is 111 feet 1 inch tall. Her index finger is 8 feet long and her nose is 4 feet 6 inches long. Her outstretched arm is 42 feet long and 12 feet thick. Needless to say, she is enourmous. Ellis Island now stands for the history of immigration to the United States. Almost 12 million people came to Ellis Island in search of the freedom and opportunity offered in America. The depot has now been preserved as a museum and is part of the national park.

properties.name: Big Ben
properties.description: Posted by ZookeeperLonden, England Big Ben is the name of the bell inside of an enourmous clock tower located in London, England. The bell is named after Sir Benjamin Hall who first ordered the bell. The man responsible for the casting of the bell was William Kimber and it was cast on April 10,1858. The bell itself weighs about thirteen tons. The clock tower is attached to the Houses of Parliment and the clock keeps vary accurate time. Its face is also enormous. The numbers on the clock are two feet high and the minute hand is fourteen feet long. The face is illuminated at night and a light shines above the clock when Parliment is in session.

properties.name: Everglades National Park
properties.description: Posted by Zookeeper  The best way to explore this 1.5 million miles of wetlands is by kayaking or canoeing down the 99 mile Wilderness Waterway. It is about a week long trip, depending on how fast you paddle, to get from one visitor center to the other. Most trips are planned during the cooler monthes because the humidity of the wetlands can be unbearable for such a long trip. Another great way to explore Everglades National Park is by car. You can take an eighty mile trip through the wilderness to see some great sites. It is also a great place for fishing, day hikes, and house boating.

properties.name: Guadalupe Moutains National Park
properties.description: Posted by Zookeeper  Guadalupe Mountains National Park is located in the Chihuahuan Desert. The Guadalupe Peak is 8,749 feet tall and is the tallest mountain in Texas. The park has been around for thirty-six years and covers 86,000 acres of land. Guadalupe Mountains National Park is a beutiful place to go hiking. It has over eighty miles of hiking trails. Some of the trails are even good for horseback riding but you must bring your own horses. There are none that you can rent at the park. It is also a great place to see the stars at night, take beutiful nature photographs, look at fossils, and go bird watching.

properties.name: Isle Royale National Park
properties.description: Posted by Zookeeper  Isle Royale National Park is on an island in Lake Supeior so it is only accesable by boat or plane. The park is very much a wilderness and has many hiking trails. It is also a great place for the experienced canoer or kayaker to go. Most of the trails are long and you should plan to stay for at least a few days. You should also bring supplies for more days than you plan to stay in case it takes longer than planned or you are enjoying your time so much that you want to stay a little longer. Isle Royale has many interesting plants to look at like the pitcher plant, the indian pipe, and the roundleaf sundew. There are also many wild berries that grow there such as the wild strawberry, the blueberry, the thimbleberry, the white baneberry the bearberry, the dewberry, and the raspberry.

properties.name: Sea of Galilee
properties.description: Posted by Zookeeperisrael The Sea of Galilee was an important place in the Bible. It is where Jesus walked on water and where the disciples fished. It is also where Jesus calmed the storm and performed other miracles. The Sea of Galilee is 46 meters below sea level and is part of the Rift Valley System. It is 23 kilometers long and 13 kilometers wide. There are twenty-three different family varieties of fish, one of them being the Telapia. The Telapia is also commonly known as the "St. Peter\'s fish".

properties.name: USS Arizona Memorial
properties.description: Posted by Zookeeper The USS Arizona memorial is in honor of the many lives that were lost do to the tragedy of Pearl Harbor on December 7, 1941. The memorial is built in the water on top of the USS Arizona were over 1,100 lives were lost.The memorial has a glass floor so visitors can look down into the water and see pieces of the ship and the oil from the ship floating in the water. The memorial is 184 feet long. The first part of the three section memorial is the entry room which leads into the flag room where there are flags of all the battle ships that where in the Battleship Row on Pearl Harbor. Next, is the assembly room, which is used for observing the ship below and for ceremonies. The final section of the memorial is the room with the marble walls with all the names of those who died engraved on the walls.

properties.name: Valley Forge National Historical Park
properties.description: Posted by Zookeeper The Valley Forge National Historical Park is in memory of the long winter spent at Valley Forge by the Contnental Army. The army was under the command of George Washington. They arrived on December 19,1777 and left on June 19, 1778. Over two thousand people died because of disease. Some of the death causeing diseases were dysentery, pnemonia, typhus, and typhoid. Supplies and reinforcements were few or nonexistant until spring By then, it was to late for some.

properties.name: Wright Brothers Memorial
properties.description: Posted by Zookeeper The Wright Brothers Natioanl Memorial is in honor of Orville and Wilbur Wright. They were the inventers and users of the first airplane. They realized, by watching birds, that their airplane wings needed curved tops to create lift. They also realized that they could control the rolling of the airplane by warping, changing the shape of the wing by moving sections of it. The memorial was located on Tate Hill in what was called Wright Field. The memorial was dedicated on August 19, 1940 with Oriville present for the ceremony. The memorial was transfered to the Air Force in 1978.

properties.name: Yellowstone National Park
properties.description: Posted by Zookeeper  Yellowstone National Park is America\'s first national park and is so enormous that it is located in three states, Wyoming, Montana, and Idaho. The park covers an area of 2,219,789 acers. It is home to wildlife such as bears, coyotes, wolves, bobcats, elk, antelope, bison, and mountain goats. The park also contains many waterfalls located on and off the hiking trails. Yellowstone National Park is home to the most famous gyser in the world,Old Faithful. Old Faithful erupts about 15 times a day or about every 90 minutes, but it does not erupt exactly on the 90 minute mark or on any other mark like some people think. The large eruption can last anywhere from two to five minutes and is preceded and followed by smaller eruptions. There are also many other gyseres and hot springs located in the park but none as famous as Old Faithful.
